chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick Reuben Blomberg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Must provide DNA sample and pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge to be taken out of prison wages and may be reduced to a civil judgment if not paid by the end of Probation. Defendant may request expungement of the DNA sample under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4) by petitioning the Wisconsin Department of Justice. Expungement of DNA is NOT a court process.    For information see: http://www.doj.state.wi.us/dles/crime-labs/clb-forms.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

No contact with victim. No drugs, no illegal drugs. No voting until civil rights are restored. No holding elective office until civil rights are restored. If not a U.S. Citizen may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
